issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: ImportInstance failed to create booting instance on HTTPS-enabled Eucalyptus Cloud

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

When using esi-* tools with HTTPS endpoints on a Eucalyptus 4.2.0 cloud, the following error occurs:
{code}
[root@d-17 ~]# cat .euca/euca-admin.ini
[region future]
autoscaling-url = https://autoscaling.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
bootstrap-url = https://bootstrap.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
cloudformation-url = https://cloudformation.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
ec2-url = https://ec2.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
elasticloadbalancing-url = https://elasticloadbalancing.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
iam-url = https://iam.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
monitoring-url = https://monitoring.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
properties-url = https://properties.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
reporting-url = https://reporting.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
s3-url = https://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
sts-url = https://sts.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
verify-ssl = true

[user 000654726341:euca-admin]
key-id =XXXXXXXXX
secret-key = XXXXXXXXX
account-id = 000654726341
certificate = /root/euca-admin-cert.pem
private-key = /root/euca-admin-pk.pem

[root@d-17 ~]# esi-describe-images --region euca-admin@future
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 123, in <module>
    ism = ServiceImageManager(args.region)
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 40, in __init__
    self._get_images()
  File "/usr/bin/esi-describe-images", line 44, in _get_images
    return self._ec2.get_all_images(filters=filters)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/ec2/connection.py", line 189, in get_all_images
    [('item', Image)], verb='POST')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/connection.py", line 1170, in get_list
    response = self.make_request(action, params, path, verb)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/connection.py", line 1116, in make_request
    return self._mexe(http_request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/connection.py", line 1030, in _mexe
    raise ex
ssl.SSLError: [Errno 1] _ssl.c:492: error:14090086:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_SERVER_CERTIFICATE:certificate verify failed
{code}
The trusted CA root certificate was added to the machine, so thats not the case.  All euca2ools work fine as well.  For example:
{code}
[root@d-17 ~]# euca-describe-keypairs verbose --region euca-admin@future
KEYPAIR	euca-admin	25:3f:e8:3f:9d:32:f7:50:47:03:ef:5c:68:af:c8:7a
KEYPAIR	devops-admin	ee:4f:93:a8:87:8d:80:8d:2c:d6:d5:60:20:a3:2d:b2
{code}

*Workaround*

Use non-HTTPS endpoints, for example, use localhost region:
{code}
[root@d-17 ~]# cat /etc/euca2ools/conf.d/localhost.ini
; Eucalyptus (all user services on localhost)

[region localhost]
autoscaling-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/AutoScaling/
cloudformation-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/CloudFormation/
ec2-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/compute/
elasticloadbalancing-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/LoadBalancing/
iam-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Euare/
monitoring-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/CloudWatch/
s3-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/objectstorage/
sts-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Tokens/

bootstrap-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Empyrean/
properties-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Properties/
reporting-url = http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Reporting/

certificate = /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem

[root@d-17 ~]# esi-describe-images --region euca-admin@localhost
    SERVICE     VERSION  ACTIVE     IMAGE      INSTANCES
    imaging       1.48     *     emi-b9391a31      1
 loadbalancing    1.48     *     emi-b9391a31      0
    database      1.48     *     emi-b9391a31      0
{code}

*Signs*

Debug output using boto:
{code}
[root@d-17 ~]# esi-describe-images --region euca-admin@future
2015-11-13 20:01:38,414 boto [DEBUG]:Using access key found in environment variable.
2015-11-13 20:01:38,414 boto [DEBUG]:Using secret key found in environment variable.
2015-11-13 20:01:38,415 boto [DEBUG]:Using access key provided by client.
2015-11-13 20:01:38,415 boto [DEBUG]:Using secret key provided by client.
2015-11-13 20:01:38,639 boto [DEBUG]:Method: POST
2015-11-13 20:01:38,639 boto [DEBUG]:Path: /

2015-11-13 20:01:38,639 boto [DEBUG]:Host: ec2.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
2015-11-13 20:01:38,639 boto [DEBUG]:Port: 443
2015-11-13 20:01:38,639 boto [DEBUG]:Params: {'Action': 'DescribeImages', 'Filter.1.Value.1': 'eucalyptus-service-image', 'Version': '2014-10-01', 'Filter.1.Name': 'tag:type'}
2015-11-13 20:01:38,639 boto [DEBUG]:establishing HTTPS connection: host=ec2.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com, kwargs={'port': 443, 'timeout': 70}
2015-11-13 20:01:38,640 boto [DEBUG]:Token: None
2015-11-13 20:01:38,640 boto [DEBUG]:CanonicalRequest:
POST
/

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.2 cloud with Eucalyptus DNS - [hspencer-75|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/75/]
# Make sure latest version of service image is installed
# Set up HTTPS endpoints (refer to DOC-1699).  Make sure and add [internal Eucalyptus CA|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/86900918/euca-ca-0.crt?version=1&modificationDate=1437149349104&api=v2] to CLC and UFS machines:
{code}
[root@d-17 ~]# update-ca-trust enable; cp euca-ca-0.crt /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/; update-ca-trust extract
{code}
# Create ini file for eucalyptus/admin user to confirm HTTPS is configured for endpoints
# Add {{verify-ssl = true}} in ini file for eucalyptus/admin user
# Attempt to describe service images:
{code}
[root@d-17 ~]# cat .euca/euca-admin.ini
[region future]
autoscaling-url = https://autoscaling.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
bootstrap-url = https://bootstrap.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
cloudformation-url = https://cloudformation.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
ec2-url = https://ec2.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
elasticloadbalancing-url = https://elasticloadbalancing.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
iam-url = https://iam.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
monitoring-url = https://monitoring.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
properties-url = https://properties.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
reporting-url = https://reporting.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
s3-url = https://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
sts-url = https://sts.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
verify-ssl = true

[user 000654726341:euca-admin]
key-id = AKIAAZRBKX7CEXS67TBU
secret-key = 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
account-id = 000654726341
certificate = /root/euca-admin-cert.pem

fields.summary: esi-* tools have issues with HTTPS endpoints

comments.body: The console always uses HTTPS to talk to the UFS endpoints. It does not, by default, validate the SSL cert. That option can be enabled in the console.ini file. We don't enable by default since UFS endpoints often have a self-signed cert.
[~dkavanagh], how to disable ssl validation? I think esi tools would need to do the same for 4.3

[~vasya], see this commit:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/80c878cc7ca45f6dd1074b3e93dce8f57040a718#diff-f9073a1c75a7a29c613e04d4e564e4a2

The block of code removed from config.py is a workaround that would work for a single-threaded thing like the tools. It monkey-patches the ssl lib, and is generally not recommended.
We ended up with the HttpsConnectionFactory in the models/auth.py file. That is passed to boto in the connection, but you may not be using boto2 in the esi- tools (like boto core, right?). There is a function for boto3 connections to disable ssl validation. See this code for an example:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/5.0-master/eucaconsole/views/__init__.py#L139
